TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He studied educational science and aircraft engineering and piloting in the former GPE ( GPE ) . From DATE until DATE he worked for the GPE airline ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE he applied for the transfer of alleged future pension rights under CARDINAL of the additional pension schemes for certain professions or groups ( Zusatzversorgungssysteme ) . On DATE the applicant 's request was dismissed . His subsequent administrative appeal , submitted on DATE , was rejected on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE he brought an action in ORG , which , following a hearing on DATE , dismissed the action , finding that the applicant did not qualify for any of the additional pension schemes . The judgment was served on the applicant on DATE . On DATE he appealed the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rendered a decision concerning a similar subject - matter , which was consistent with ORG decision in the instant case . On DATE ORG advised the parties of ORG decision and classified the case as ready for decision .

CARDINAL . During the course of the appeal proceedings the applicant 's representative declared that he was seeking fundamental clarification of the subject - matter before ORG . ORG therefore awaited a decision of that court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the judge rapporteur enquired whether the appeal was to continue after ORG on DATE ( file no . CARDINAL BvR CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) had declined to admit for examination a constitutional complaint in a similar case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's representative announced that he would submit further observations until DATE . After a reminder of ORG on DATE these observations were submitted on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal and refused to grant leave to appeal on points of law . On DATE the judgment was served on the applicant 's representative .

CARDINAL . Within the statutory time limit the applicant 's representative objected to the refusal to grant leave to appeal on points of law and reasoned the objection on DATE . On DATE ORG dismissed the objection as inadmissible . This decision was served on the applicant 's representative on DATE .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of ORG Act exempts applicants from the requirement to await the outcome of the preliminary administrative proceedings and allows them to lodge a court action directly with ORG if the administrative authorities fail without sufficient justification to decide the administrative appeal within a reasonable time , in general DATE .
